name: List your notifications
description: List all notifications for the current user, sorted by most recently updated.

params.name: all
params.description: If `true`, show notifications marked as read.

params.name: participating
params.description: If `true`, only shows notifications in which the user is directly participating or mentioned.

params.name: since
params.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: before
params.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

name: List your notifications in a repository
description: List all notifications for the current user.

params.name: all
params.description: If `true`, show notifications marked as read.

params.name: participating
params.description: If `true`, only shows notifications in which the user is directly participating or mentioned.

params.name: since
params.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: before
params.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

name: Mark as read
description: Marking a notification as "read" removes it from the [default view on GitHub](https://github.com/notifications).

params.name: last_read_at
params.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked. Anything updated since this time will not be updated. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

name: Mark notifications as read in a repository
description: Marking all notifications in a repository as "read" removes them from the [default view on GitHub](https://github.com/notifications).

params.name: last_read_at
params.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked. Anything updated since this time will not be updated. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

name: Get a Thread Subscription
description:
This checks to see if the current user is subscribed to a thread. You can also [get a Repository subscription](/v3/activity/watching/#get-a-repository-subscription).

Note that subscriptions are only generated if a user is participating in a conversation--for example, they've replied to the thread, were **@mention**ed, or manually subscribe to a thread.

name: Set a Thread Subscription
description: This lets you subscribe or unsubscribe from a conversation. Unsubscribing from a conversation mutes all future notifications (until you comment or get **@mention**ed once more).

params.name: subscribed
params.description: Determines if notifications should be received from this thread

params.name: ignored
params.description: Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this thread
